CatDescriptText: Mrs. Pricilla Clansy, 1850 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should well defined courses in sex education be taught in public school system? If so, at what grade should the teaching of these courses begin?" answer reads: "Yes, I do, and the reason is that when the kids go out into the public they will know how to act.  I think that the education should begin around the age of 13."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pricilla Clansy wearing dark sleeveless double button down collared shirt, pendant earrings, and three strand beaded necklace, carrying dark handbag and paper bags, standing in front of store with pedestrians walking in background
